actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Thursday, July 24, 2025,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Thursday, July 24, 2025, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S. 2480 (Sen. Wyden):
        A bill to require the Secretary of Homeland Security to publicly release, in full, the unclassified report titled "U.S. Telecommunications Insecurity 2022", and for other purposes.

        -- Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

PN12-7:
        Samuel Brown, of Nevada, to be Under Secretary of Veterans Affairs for Memorial Affairs

        -- Considered by Senate.


 PN22-17:
        Earl Matthews, of Virginia, to be General Counsel of the Department of Defense

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 45. Record Vote Number: 440 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate and vote 7/29/2025.


 PN25-8:

 PN345-20:
        David Wright, of South Carolina, to be a Member of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission for the term of five years expiring June 30, 2030

        -- Considered by Senate. By Unanimous Consent.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 45. Record Vote Number: 438

By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Lee, at  8:08 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
